name: Sweet Rolls
author: Charlotte Hooper
instructions: Dissolve yeast in lukewarm water. Heat milk and shortening until lukewarm. Beat eggs and add sugar and salt to this. Pour in milk and shortening. Add flour to make a thick batter like cake. Add the yeast mixture. Add more flour until smooth and satiny. Let rise for 2 hours. Roll out on floured board, about 1/4 inch thick. Melt 1 1/4 stick margarine and pour over dough. Then sprinkle sugar and cinna- mon over the dough. Roll like a jelly roll. Slice into rolls about 1/4 inch thick and place on greased pan. Let rise for 1 hour. Bake in 400° to 425° oven for around 10 to 12 minutes. Top with icing.
